Generation V.Black: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
Generation V.White: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.
Generation V.Black 2: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.
Generation V.White 2: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.

Generation VI.X: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
Generation VI.Y: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.

Generation VII.Sun: They move in groups of a few individuals. A female is often the leader of the group, and the males will gather food.
Generation VII.Moon: Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Krokorok really hates it when its body gets cold. On nights when the temperature drops, it digs deep into the desert sands.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It buries some of its prey in the sand to use as emergency meals when its hunts are unsuccessful.

Generation VIII.Sword: Krokorok has specialized eyes that enable it to see in the dark. This ability lets Krokorok hunt in the dead of night without getting lost.
Generation VIII.Shield: Although this Pokémon has specialized eyes that allow it to see in the dark, Krokorok won't move much at night—the desert gets cold after sunset.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.
Generation IX.Violet: Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.
